result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad A Kizewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs due during period of supervision.
  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Attend assessment for Anger Management and any follow-up deemed appropriate.
Submit to DNA sample by 3/25/16 and pay surcharge.

Sentencing hearing at 03-09-2016 09:30 am

Restitution hearing to be heard before sentencing. Defendant Chad A Kizewski in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim does not appear. Br 3 clerk  had advised the DA's office of a voice message earlier in the week from a caller identified as the victim stating unable to appear due to hospitalization. DA's office has not been able to contact the victim. Court will reschedule.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.

(Case called with co-defendant case 15CM599) Defendant Chad A Kizewski in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel have issue with restitution being requested.  Court sets matter over and gives deadline of 1/8/16 for any restitution submission by victims. No violent contact with co-defendant T.K.
Sentencing hearing at 12-21-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Chad A Kizewski in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests adjournment to review new restitution information. Plea questionnaire filed.  State recommends sentence withheld - 18 mos probation, anger management classes, restitution joint & several, no contact with victim unless approved by victim and agent. Court examines defendant on plea questionnaire. Defendant changes plea to no contest. Court accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Counsel requesting modify bail conditition to no violent contact with co-defendant. State has no objection. Court so grants. Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
